title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-2.2 - Service of notice of appeal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-2.2 - Service of notice of appeal

State Regulations

Within 30 days after service of a copy of the report, findings and recommendation of the county medical society, or of the workers'
compensation committee of the county medical society, the accused physician, medical bureau or laboratory may appeal therefrom to the Medical Appeals Unit
by serving written notice of appeal, personally or by mail, upon the secretary
of the Medical Appeals Unit, 100 Broadway-Menands, Albany, NY 12241, and also
upon the county medical society or the workers' compensation committee of the
county medical society, whichever made the report, findings and recommendation
from which appeal is taken. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
326-2.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
